content.title: Celiprolol Evidence in Vascular EDS
content.description: Evidence for celiprolol therapy in reducing vascular events in vascular Ehlers-Danlos syndrome

key_concepts.details: Beta-blocker with vasodilating properties; may reduce arterial wall stress and improve collagen synthesis
Ong et al. Lancet 2010 RCT showed 3-fold reduction in arterial events with celiprolol
Typically titrated to 400mg twice daily if tolerated
Small trial size, limited availability of celiprolol in some countries

content.clinical_significance: Currently the only medication with RCT evidence for reducing vEDS complications
content.statement: Celiprolol Evidence in Vascular EDS is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Genetic-Disorders that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of Celiprolol Evidence in Vascular EDS.
